translation:
Most Illustrious Sir

Enclosed are the aforementioned Colonels Joaquim Pedro and José Mariano de Matos and a captain and a soldier; immediately Your Lordship Antônio Manuel do Amaral went to the town of Jaguarão to plunder with 150 men and was repelled by the police of Jaguarão, assisted by the infantry and navy, with Amaral himself and a lieutenant and 5 or 6 soldiers killed and a lieutenant and 6 soldiers wounded, and on our side we had to lament a sergeant killed; this is what the same captain who is imprisoned, who was present at the attack, tells me; so far I have not received official news; if the men of the 2nd Corps who remained to bring armament have not yet left, Your Lordship Canguçu.

May God keep Your Lordship  
Campo nas pontas de Piratini, June 28, 1844.

Most Illustrious Sir Luís José Ferreira  
Lieutenant-Colonel Commander of the Garrison of the city of Pelotas  
Francisco Pedro de Abreu
